website_summaries.verdict: The Razer Tiamat 7.1 is an excellent-sounding gaming headset with plenty of bass, and while it's pricey for a wired headset, it's one of the best we've seen yet.
cons: Surround sound still doesn't image quite as well as a surround sound speaker system

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: The plastic bridge holding the mic started breaking within the first year, then it only got worse from there and I had to use glue to hold its 2 pieces together and a rubber band to hold the mic up after it totally broke from the ear piece and was dangling by the wire inside it.
customer_reviews.author: Jasem

customer_reviews.title: Never have done that and was pretty worried about it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these used from Amazon. Never have done that and was pretty worried about it. The headset was in great condition and the package was the same. Only thing that was nasty, was the sound control unit looked like they ate a bag of Cheetos while using it........Gross As for the operations of the headsets, the verdict is still in session. I have not used them enough to get the best sound out of them. They do sound great, just not sure about the 7.1 thing, as I can't really tell any different. I give them 5 stars for now, if something of interest pops up in the future, I'll come back and update this review
customer_reviews.author: Online Addict

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming and voice chat, nope for music
customer_reviews.text: Not great for multifunctional (eg, gaming AND music... Music just sounds bad). Individual channel volumes and mastter volume are nice, multiple drivers in each earpiece make true 7.1 sound. Great for gaming and voice chat. Skip if you need music. After... 2 or 3 years, the detant that holds the mic up in place write out and resulted in a boom with erectile dysfunction. But after using them that long, I sure got my money out of them! 👍
customer_reviews.author: D0c

customer_reviews.title: eye candy, that is all
customer_reviews.text: This headset was beautiful comfortable and has a solid design, it looks powerful and of the highest caliber for a gaming headset. However the small drivers provide hollow sound, only redeemed by incredible bass. It truly is 7.1 but I prefer my turtle beaches 50mm drivers and virtual 7.1 conversion. I sent these back because they didn't sound good after trying two different high-end sound cards, one from Creative and the other from asus. Honestly just get a traditional headset and use software to create 7.1 surround.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I love these for gaming. I can hear footsteps in BF4 and be able to determine location of shootouts or when the enemy yells: "We got a man down over here!" However, don't rely on these for music. But with the control pad that allows you to switch between speakers and headphones on the fly, it makes for an awesome setup. Browsing the net? Speakers. Watching a movie? Speakers. Going to play BF4? Hit the headset button and toss em on your head. They work great in skype and in-game communication. Best headset I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenhurst

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, very configurable
customer_reviews.text: My favorite features so far on this headset are: • Retractable headset. I don't need the mic very often, so it's nice that I can tuck it away and have it physically covered. • Mute microphone switch on the base station • Toggle 7.1 or stereo on the base station • Toggle external speaker pass through on base station • Long term comfort • Durable construction You should be able to find the right combination of settings for your game fairly easily, but being able to flip off 7.1 if you're listening to a podcast or don't have time to fiddle with the settings is a really huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great 7.1 headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound but only after getting the EQ settings on my soundcard tuned for FPS and the levels set appropriately in the control pad attached to the headphones. The quality of the item is excellent but the earpads were a bit small and uncomfortable so, I just changed them to a velour earpad (Beyerdynamic EDT250V) and the headphones are now very comfortable. A noticeable improvement vs my old 5.1 headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure you have one of the recommended sounds cards for it
customer_reviews.text: For anyone thinking about getting a Razer Tiamat 7.1, go for it! Just make sure you have one of the recommended sounds cards for it. A sound card makes a HUGE difference in what it sounds like, vs running it from your onboard sound. Connected to my mobo they sound anemic and have NO bass. Connected to my sound card, (PCI Express Sound Blaster X-Fi Titanium Fatal1ty Champion Series) they are INCREDIBLE! They have incredible range and the bass literally vibrates my skull.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: It's Good But
customer_reviews.text: It leaves u wanting more here's an example your music comes alive in 2.1 but dies in 7.1 why the hell should it die when i upgrade the experience. long story short there ok but as far as music headsets go they suck gaming however is good but the same effect still applies after awhile being in 7.1 u feel like ur missing something which is a shame because i really had high hopes for this since i already own a lycossa keyboard and a Mamba 2012 edition, both being products of razor, and i just bought those hammerhead earbuds and there ferox speakers for my phone which both turned out to be decent razor products.
customer_reviews.author: Ryu Takeru

customer_reviews.title: Big but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Although very large they are very comfortable and no ear sweating. I have played for hours with these on and only once when the temp got to 80 in the room did I notice any ear sweat. I used Logitech G930 before these and my ears would start to sweat within a hour of use. I don't use voice so I cant comment on the mic quality but it does seem awkward in its positioning. The sounds is awesome giving a great 7.1 sound considering its all in a headset. The only issues I would have it the cord length, I think it should have been a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: whataboutbob

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality are good. Some may think that lows is not good ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a bit struggle setting up my cheap mother board to support multichannel output. I had to download driver to teach mother board to output sound through "line in" and "mic in". All I have got from that setup is 5.1 sound, which is enough. You don't get too many content with 7.1. Most of games and movies comes with 5.1. Sound quality are good. Some may think that lows is not good enough. But I like it that way. Soft and gentle. Lights is a frustrating, even if you turn off pc headphone cups glows. Very distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Rovshan Mammadov

customer_reviews.title: I barely use them because I have other head phones that sound way better. I bought these feeding into the snake oil ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is pure s***. I barely use them because I have other head phones that sound way better. I bought these feeding into the snake oil of 7.1 surround sound. I suggest buying good 2 speaker drivers for head phones for the same price and get at least 6 times better audio. Software can be used to emulate surround sound way better than even a movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Smith

customer_reviews.title: i hear your thoughts now!!
customer_reviews.text: this baby rocks, but the razer dude is kinda colorblind or have a eagle eye... omg the cable colors were hard to see. Once you got that figured out (honestly, the only hard part) you got a really nice pair to join the horde forces against the alliance. Also they are really comfortable for long hours of pvp and gy camping lok tar ogar!!
customer_reviews.author: Fernando J. Subercaseaux

customer_reviews.title: I love them but...
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones so much, but they just don't really last more than a year these headphones are awesome with true 7.1 surround sound and 10 drivers, but it's built so cheaply it uses plastic and the speakers aren't amazing quality I would recommend getting the newest Razer headphones instead of these
customer_reviews.author: Roket Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good All Around
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the head phones for over a month now, and so far pretty good. -very clear sound -surround sound works great -mic from what i have been told is clear, and some times weak, but that was due to skype. All in all the head phones good quality and comfortable. I would recommend these if you like Razer, and what they make, also if you are looking for good head phones for chatting and gaming. I could see them being ok for basic recording, and live streaming but for the more serious folks i would look up others or have a separate microphone.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and endurance.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good. I've use 7.1 surround and its great although I have no prior experience to compare it to, i bought these 3 years ago and from what I can tell the sound quality has not deteriorated much if at all the only thing that happened was the foam covers that go over your ears started coming off I used glue on them and it worked great, but after 3 years of use I expected it to start to break down in some way. Besides that they look as good as when I first got them
customer_reviews.author: Joel Sutterfield

customer_reviews.title: Get laid
customer_reviews.text: Now, because of 5 drivers per ear and actual 7.1 surround technology. All of my music is new. So I'm wasting days and days listening to it. Also...video games are way more intense. I am a god on the battlefield now....which has also wated days. These headphones have made me lose my girlfriend, job, house, friends, and my dog died....they are that good.
customer_reviews.author: CMartin

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck? Probably not -- Still a great headset though.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through SEVERAL headsets from different brands but this headset gets a 4 for sound and mic quality. As for overall comfort, this headset is probably the second comfiest I've ever had. Personally, I prefer wireless headsets even though I'm sitting at a PC. I hate fiddling with cords, but like I said, still a four in my book based on ear cup comfort and sound quality. Good headset, but you can prolly find a comparable one for cheaper. I only chose this one because I've had great results from Razer products and was afraid to buy a similar Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Dean

customer_reviews.title: Razer Tiamat 7.1 Analog Nov-11-13
customer_reviews.text: i love these babies! the only con i see is the mic volume is low... but there is a easy fix i found out ... just go through the settings for microphone and do a mic boost of 10% and boom! people can hear you ... the audio is amazing... by the way it' s not meant for music... music isn't 7.1 one yet.. so you will have to switch it back to 2.1 audio for music but for movies and gaming.... OMG! AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Wearing this headset it feels heave but is comfortable definitely one of the better headsets for comfort
customer_reviews.text: Wearing this headset it feels heave but is comfortable definitely one of the better headsets for comfort. However be sure you have plently of plus space as it takes many plugs to make it work well even then it dosnt tend to work well with other sounds cards and such.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: The Shipping service liked but the product was different in what this in ...
customer_reviews.text: The Shipping service liked but the product was different in what this in the photo instead of the V1 came to V2
customer_reviews.author: Edivaldo

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile; fully customizable.
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile; fully customizable. Decent sound quality (7.1 works great!) I'm used to Bose noise cancelling headphones / headsets; despite claiming to be noise cancelling, they're not. They muffle environmental noise / sounds, but are not actually noise cancelling. Microphone works well and because you can adjust both transmit and receiving voice, they are ideal for team play. Very lightweight and comfortable (not as much as Bose...). A great feature is the speaker "bypass" which allows you to use a normal non-headphone/set speaker when you just want normal sound. Saves you from having to unplug/plug every time you want to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: These headphones worked for a while. But, the ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked for a while. But, the material on the cushions is extremely thin, and it's what binds the cushions to the frame, so when it rips (which it will), the sound quality drops dramatically. Probably won't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan E.

customer_reviews.title: Good positional sound,overall sound quality not great.
customer_reviews.text: Not really good for music,kind of low quality sound for the price.Can tell when someone is behind you quite well when set up.That said they refuse to plug and play with my on-board sound even though it is 7.1.So no rear channel and no mike.Makes them kind of useless in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie X

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A HORRIBLE HEADSET!
customer_reviews.text: WHAT A HORRIBLE HEADSET! I've read great reviews for this headset which leads me to believe you have not worn a decent headset before, therefore you don't understand quality. Before owning these I had sennheiser pc333d headest which was PHENOMENAL. No need to have any fancy sound card, it came with a usb plug in sound card with 7.1 dolby surround sound technology. There is no bass on my headset, of which razer declined to even help me with. To top it all off, I am at my computer for many long hours a day making youtube videos and they are BEYOND uncomfortable. I can't wait for my refund so I can buy a real headset.
customer_reviews.author: sean lozano

customer_reviews.title: Its nice and good headset
customer_reviews.text: They were for my bro. I've used them before for a long period of time. As I go to his PC to play his games. I personaly own the SteelSeries elite Prism. they are both nice of a headset. and this one has "real 7.1" and the Prisms have "virtual 7.1" Took a while to mess with the on board sound to make it sound good. it was worth the time to make it sound good.
customer_reviews.author: Ed boy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Truly these were a let down to say the least, I would strongly encourage others to reconsider when thinking of buying from this company. I say this after owning many goods from them ( keyboards, mice, mice pads, game controllers, and now headphones). So far Razer has been a huge let down for all products except for my deathstalker keyboard. My headband broke on the second time wearing them, they were overly heavy, tight and like most of their products, in my experience didn't come close to the claims made by the company.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Im not a crazy audiophile and these sound great to me for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Im not a crazy audiophile and these sound great to me for gaming. Lots of nice heavy bass and clear highs. The microphone works well but you need to be careful when pulling it out of the earpiece, the plastic on the mic is flimsy and its easy to pull too hard and break it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: perfection
customer_reviews.text: with full 7.1 neodymium drivers, with the subwoofer being a full 40mm driver, this is much more than i expected. the control box attached to the headset is especially useful, with the pass through being very convenient for when people are over. all the buttons are on the box, as well as volume control and control for each individual driver
customer_reviews.author: Josephdalepi

customer_reviews.title: The headphones themselves are pretty good. They lack the fidelity I was hoping ...
customer_reviews.text: The headphones themselves are pretty good. They lack the fidelity I was hoping for, and sadly when they are on 7.1 mode they have zero bass whatsoever. I don't mean that it isn't shaking my teeth out of my head bass, I mean zero bass.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one I'm buying, first one ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I'm buying, first one lasted about 3 years so I replaced it before it died. Solid sound, okay mic, and decent durability. Update ~7 months? later. Took them off my head and the right earpiece broke off. This happened on my first one but I believed it to be my fault so I took amazing care of these things. I was careful taking them off every time and this still happened. They were great until they broke, I don't think I'm buying another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Solis

customer_reviews.title: Best Razer Headphones
customer_reviews.text: They sound very good set at 5.1 surround since they have 5 speakers in each ear cup. They are also louder when set at 5.1 than 7.1. They have good bass and treble and they don't distort. They fit really well over your entire ear and I wear glasses and I have no complaints with how they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Syprus

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. Works well
customer_reviews.text: PC: This is a great product. Works well, good sound quality, especially for surround sound. Can be used without surround sound if you don't have 7.1 support. MAC: Good product, but not worth the money even though compatible as a normal headphones system. It works and produces sound, but the microphone will not show up under external microphones, and the 7.1 is unusable. If you are looking for MAC, get something cheaper that doesn't have surround sound or an external mic.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Powell

customer_reviews.title: I have to say overall this is an amazing headset. It's quality is great
customer_reviews.text: I have to say overall this is an amazing headset. It's quality is great, the sound is amazing, the mic is clear as can be. The only downside is after multiple hours of gaming it seems that my ears are in discomfort. I might just have big ears but this presents a huge problem with extended hours of wearing the headset.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headset.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound and ergonomics. The leathery cushions get quite hot after an hour of gaming, so take some breaks... The side panels come off quite easily, but it isn't an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Sound is great! I hardly recognized my games. Make sure your sound card supports 7.1 for best results. They also have a very nice feature that makes it easy to tie into your desktop speakers if you choose too. Cord is not super long, but is adequate, and is attached to the left ear piece.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchel D

customer_reviews.title: The best true surround sound headset.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best true surround sound headset in the entire world because they come with 7.1 individual jack for your on-board audio or your creative sound card, keep it in mind that the creative audio cards come in 5.1 channels and you should miss the side audio for the surround but you will never notice the miss. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Posadas

customer_reviews.title: Great headset. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones don't have the strongest pounding bass for music, but for gaming, they are incredible. The sound quality is excellent and you can hear things creeping up behind you when playing games and I love the volume knob for quick volume adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio

customer_reviews.title: Love it, just takes time to get used to the sound
customer_reviews.text: I went from a basic analog headset to this after putting my audio card in, and theres a considerable difference. However, if you're not used to a surround sound headset, the sound feels a little off until you adapt to it. Love the headset though. Razer makes great products! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound quality, solid build, best headset i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This headset is by far the best sounding headset I have ever heard. Razer didn't mess around when they built this headset, true 7.1 means true 7.1. To name faults in the Razer Tiamat 7.1 is truly just nitpicking, but I do have a few qualms. First, the shape of the headstrap is slightly uncomfortable during long play sessions, and the headset is pretty heavy and surely noticable while being worn. Overall, I would reccommend this headset to any and everyone including gamers, audiophiles, streamers, and movie buffs, this is truly a fantastic headset.
customer_reviews.author: kyler

customer_reviews.title: The Tiamat is not "over ear", at least not ...
customer_reviews.text: The Tiamat is not "over ear", at least not for me (and I don't have big ears). These were very uncomfortable to wear for any period of time. After only 10 minutes I had to take them off because my ears and head were hurting so much. Perhaps if you have a smaller head/ears these would work for you, but for me they weren't big enough
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nag-proof headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my boyfriend for his birthday. He absolutely loves them. He does need to get a better sound card to fully support them. No big deal, though. They are very sound proof. When I am yelling at him about 5 feet away, he doesn't notice until my arms start flailing. Which, for him, is fantastic. Great buy. I will be recommending them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Brinks

customer_reviews.title: Love this headset
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this headset 100% to anyone that needs quality audio for gaming or recording/editing. Well worth what I paid for it and I bought this from previously buying a razer kraken pro headset and it is a night and day difference in quality. I dont use the retractable mic because I use a desktop mic so I cant be certain whether it is actually good. Outstanding headset though.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and adjuste on your head automatic
customer_reviews.text: It looks pretty,comfortable, and adjuste on your head automatic, so you dont have to do it every time. I like the surround sound as well.
customer_reviews.author: Abtin

customer_reviews.title: Best Analog 7.1 Headset on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used this headset for about a month for gaming. The audio quality is great but can be better. (I blame this on my onboard sound.) The headset fits comfortably for long periods of time and the cable is an acceptable length. However, I recently encountered a problem that I'm certain is uncommon. Between the amp and headset the cable braiding split and the cable slipped out. It has since kinked and all left audio has failed. I understand that this can happen on occasion so I don't consider this a dealbreaker. I am currently getting it replaced. I would strongly suggest anyone who wants an exceptional 7.1 experience to purchase this great headset.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset
customer_reviews.text: The headset is heavier than many others, but it's not too heavy. The sound quality is amazing; however, to utilize it to its full potential you will need a sound card. Doesn't have to be an expensive one, but I went from using my motherboard for the sound to a sound card and it was an impressive change. My only qualms with this product would be the microphone. The quality is good, but it is VERY quiet. Perhaps I've missed a few options to boost it more (yes, I've used microphone boost etc). Any ways, great headset, great sound, HIGHLY recommend a sound card though. Oh! Also very comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I recommend to use with a desktop unless you want to buy a sound card. The sound on these is insane. You can hear everything and they really make you feel like you're in the action. or music. On my laptop i use Sabrent USB-SND8 8-Channel 3D USB 2.0 External 7.1 Surround Sound Box
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great headset.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Razer headset. For the first time ever I get to play my FPS games with 7.1 surround. What a difference is makes. Sound quality is really good. I like that I can occasionally switch to my external speakers with a touch of a button. It is a little on the heavy side though and occasionally get a sore neck if I play for too many hours at a time. But on the whole I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Graham C. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Durability not good.
customer_reviews.text: I've had somewhat bad luck with headsets in the past, so I decided i'd treat myself with the best I could afford. I purchased my new headset with care and treated them the same, never throwing them around once or treating them badly. After less than a year i've discovered a problem with the right earpiece, it pops and scratches from time to time as if its broken. But no damage appears to be visible, would no recommend purchasing. Ontop of all of this, the microphone has been terrible from day one, it has a very closeted sound inaudible to some people. Once again, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ben cowman

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like you're there
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for gaming, which is the intended use and does provide for a great experience, but I was really impressed with the way orchestral arrangements sounded. Using these to just listen to music makes you feel like you're in front of the orchestra. Very happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: A good set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: A good set of headphones, quite comfortable, though the auto-adjusting head band is a tad annoying at times. The in-line control module has a USB for power, but it doesn't seem to offer any amplification itself, so a soundcard is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hill

customer_reviews.title: OH MY GOD
customer_reviews.text: Let's just say this, this headset is Amazing for gaming. I play on a Cyberpower Black Mamba III and i use an ASUS 7.1 sound card, AND i got these for only $125 dollars, that was an amazing deal when you consider what you get. -5 drivers in each ear cup -A VERY HIGH VOLUME OUTPUT -high quality, and powerful, bass -epic comfort -shiny lights -In-Line audio and mic controls -Chuck Norris beard trimmings -stylish packaging -stickers! - and even a mic that is basically a mini ninja hiding in your left earcup
customer_reviews.author: jimmie williams

customer_reviews.title: Too small and tight, too quiet when cranked up ...
customer_reviews.text: Too small and tight, too quiet when cranked up, and sound is fairly hollow for me even after hours of playing with settings.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Wearing for more than 4-6 hours hurts my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Wearing for more than 4-6 hours hurts my ears like hell. The sound sounds like ass without modifying it, in my experience anyway. I had to use Realtek HD Audio Manager to boost bass to make it actually sound like a high price headset. After that, everything was okay.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Stone

customer_reviews.title: A-
customer_reviews.text: i only give this 4 stars because of the wire, i know they are a necessary evil but i keep getting tangled in them and dropping the control box which caused a weird humm in the left ear, RMA'd for a new set Razer was great. Best sounding headset for BF4 and Race games. paired with a ASUS Phoebus sound card it pumps the base that is needed. onbaord just doesnt have the power needed for this great headset.
customer_reviews.author: G13Homi

customer_reviews.title: This is a great headset, comfortable and i love the dial instead ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great headset, comfortable and i love the dial instead of downloading frimware... the only downside to this product is the mic. It does not hold a candle to the sound quality of Logitech. This is the first and only razer product i have bought. I love the headsets audio quality and how crisp the sound is, just disappointed in the bass and the mic quality
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, Mic & comfort
customer_reviews.text: You're really getting what you're pay for, honestly, I wouldn't of minded more dollars, It's worth it. Just make sure you don't confuse item defectiveness with human brain defectiveness. I thought It was messed up, but in the end, I just plugged things into the wrong hole. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Strifeheart

customer_reviews.title: Wanted so bad to like this
customer_reviews.text: I loved eveything about this headset, the sound quality, the comfort, the control interface...ALL excellent. Unfortunately the microphone did not work and I returned the set. I tried everything to the point where I got fed up and returned to a simple usb headset that works.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and intuitive controls.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer by any means, but I am a film editor. I bought these as a work headset after borrowing them from a friend for a week. Excellent sound quality and the ability to pass the audio through to surround sound speakers is something I'll probably implement in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend if you're upgrading your PC gaming set up
customer_reviews.text: Redefined playing games for me - I was hearing all kinds of things I never noticed before with lesser quality headsets. Definitely recommend if you're upgrading your PC gaming set up.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Heisler

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Worst headset I have ever bought. Mic did not function on original, replacement set it worked for a day. Sound was decent but base was terrible in 7.1 mode, in non 7.1 it was ok. Overall a good set of headphones is better than the 7 cheap drivers in ear for sound.
customer_reviews.author: The Rear Test

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchase less then three months ago and has already broken at the connection between the head piece and the ear. This item is not a good value for the money. It is no longer returnable and did not come with a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Lee Ramer

customer_reviews.text: 2nd Pair, not alot of headsts in the market are true 7.1 sound.
customer_reviews.author: FILIPINOY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sounds, could use some comfort tweaking.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds phenomenal! Crisp highs, strong and deep lows, and great positional audio. It does take a little tinkering with your sound card settings to get setup right, but if you do that, you're in for a treat. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the ear cups are too small and make my (admittedly large) ears hurt after a couple hours of use. Other than that, I'm totally happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Keene

customer_reviews.title: Not that comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This was not as comfortable as it looked. No way to adjust band and it presses against head. Although it is soft it is annoying. Replaced with Razor Kraken for a lot less and much happier.
customer_reviews.author: kate clark

customer_reviews.title: great set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: It's razer, great set of headphones, just make sure you have a soundcard onboard which is 7.1 otherwise get something else.
customer_reviews.author: T00nZ

customer_reviews.title: not enough words to describe
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST headphones we have ever owned. We have been playing online FPS and MMORPG games since dial-up and have purchased and used many different headphones. These are everything any TRUE gamer really needs.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Y

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and control! Now to upgrade the rest of the package.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Razer Tiamat Over Ear 7.1!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent result for free delivery! Seller polite, responsible, tracking number and the order he sent as soon as possible. Product description is identical with reality - see the screenshot in the appendix. Track numbers are tracked perfectly, was issued simultaneously with sending goods. Order satisfied, recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed these while gamming. I have surround sound system in my room but playing late at night and early in the AM I don't have to wake up the house with my fun.
customer_reviews.author: William Hartsock

customer_reviews.title: its a nice headset and has a great true 7
customer_reviews.text: if you have big ears/head and you want over the ear headphone this isnt for you, its a nice headset and has a great true 7.1 sound-- hooked up correctly .
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! I use these all the time. Some of the best headphones I've ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: CorgiZack

customer_reviews.title: The mic isn't the best design for me
customer_reviews.text: These are very hot on the ear and heavy on the head. The mic isn't the best design for me, it's like an armature and hard to manage and manipulate and flex. They didn't last as long as I thought they should....less than a year when the mic died.
customer_reviews.author: sherry jung

customer_reviews.title: The sound was good. The construction was not very sturdy as the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headphones for around 2 years of casual use. The sound was good. The construction was not very sturdy as the headphones eventually broke where the ear piece connects to the headband, it is head together by very thin plastic at that point. They worked well, I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rognerud

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the headset is not good. its been over a year now and there ...
customer_reviews.text: have it set up with sound card, Quality of the headset is not good. its been over a year now and there are cracks all over the plastic and i take good care of them. Mic quality is bad and the drivers always mess up. my 7 year old asto A40 have better sound and mic quality than these i feel.
customer_reviews.author: shokei

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound position.
customer_reviews.text: I gave these 4.5 stars but this rating doesn't have .5 --- lol The reason is that after hours and hours of use.. I find that the weight of all those drivers pushes the otherwise very comfortable head-band into my scalp. The suckers are heavy, especially when compared to the Megalodon (usb). The sound is clear. The bass respond is powerful, but not quite BOOMING. The sound positioning is outstanding. My gaming has definitely benefited from the ability to locate opponents by the noise they make (weapons, walking, talking). I'd highly recommend this headset, but if you are playing against me, don't bother because I'd like to keep the advantage!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These things sound great, with a good sound card of course.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus R. Storms

customer_reviews.title: excellent pick
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound, great quality, great for gaming and comfortable, odd button setup on the controller, but hard to setup for those not familiar with setting up sound equipment. Also alot of games dont support 7.1 so you have to switch to 5.1 or lower for some games.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Badass

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I am happy and satisfied to have this Set, I have owned this for almost 2 years and still in good shape! Make sure your computer supports 7.1
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality headset but the sound sucks,i have razer chimaera and have better sound
customer_reviews.author: WALTERDV13

customer_reviews.title: This is my husbands 2nd or 3rd pair. He ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my husbands 2nd or 3rd pair. He loves them for gaming. The reason he has had multiple pairs is not the fault of them but a lot of use and often times being knocked on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin P.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Sound over all is very good but in game you find that the side and back sound is weak and the tension of the headstrap squeeses too hard with no way to adjust this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Vines

customer_reviews.title: don't buy those headsets
customer_reviews.text: I expected more than what i heard mostly im disappointed. sound quality isn't so good 7.1 isn't so special i thought it might be nicer but i was wrong in a comfy aspect it's not comfortable at all and not worth the price either over all if u read this comment stay away from this headset its not worth it !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable headset ever
customer_reviews.text: I can seriously wear this for an entire weekend and can forget that I am wearing a headset, and instead think that my computer just beams sound into my head. The mic isn't the greatest but a studio mic is a better option in any situation where one requires real clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: VERY COOL. WHEN YOU TURN THE PLAYERS HEAD THE DIRECTION OF THE AUDIO CHANGES WITH IT!
customer_reviews.author: sr2000

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, difficult setup.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality, but setup and calibration was a pain. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Durden

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. it did excetly what it suppose to do and it was deleiverd on time. My son loves the quaity this piece delievers.
customer_reviews.author: Kareem Alyousif

customer_reviews.title: Great, once you set it up
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my laptop in conjunction with an external sound card. Setup on this thing is a beast! Seriously..I gave up and sold it to a friend (who has had a much better time making it work).
customer_reviews.author: Tim E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best PC headphones that I've ever worn. The 7.1 isn't a gimmick like on many other "surround" headsets that are sold on Amazon and at places like Frys, these have individual drivers inside the headphone cups for each speaker that needs to exist.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Kocher

customer_reviews.title: 7.1 Headset nice surround, not a good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This headsets, are pretty good on surround terms, if you play a lot of PC games (specially shooters) it gives you the sound position of enemies or allies. But the quality of the sound on 7.1 is not good. If you are looking for quality in surround is not the best choice. If you disable the 7.1 configuration the sound has a good quality, but not the best. Also are very comfortable. Recommended for long hours of playing.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: make sure u install software and amazing sound, love it
customer_reviews.author: Robert K

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: As far as sound quality goes, top notch, as far as wearability... not so much. After about an hour of wearing the headset the ribbed elastic head rest (flat would have been better) and ear pads start to get uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bnwy1

customer_reviews.title: for gamers by gamers so to speak
customer_reviews.text: Overall the listening part is 5 stars wonderful control over 7.1 surround sound . But the only thing I do not like and is a big problem for me is the mic, it often goes quite when I'm talking and I have to readjust it , but overall this is a great head set and I do recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Razer Tiamat Over Ear 7.1
customer_reviews.text: I love these bad boys I use them so much I am glad they can handle the heavy game play use I do on them
customer_reviews.author: Phantom Phreak

customer_reviews.title: great product, with no misuse
customer_reviews.text: Asome sound.. great product, with no misuse, product is decently built.
customer_reviews.author: Mic-=Z=-

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: Note, if you purchase these and you have a mac... you'll have to get an external sound card... you can also purchase on Amazon. Then you'll plug the headphones into the sound card.
customer_reviews.author: Scott & Holly Schuemann

customer_reviews.title: Fine for gaming, not music
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Directional sound In-line surround sound controls Plenty of cable Can output to desktop speakers with in-line switch Cons: Background static at all volumes Extremely uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time Poor overall build quality, especially the mic boom
customer_reviews.author: Gantt

customer_reviews.title: 7.1 Surround Sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were worth the price, with an inbuilt controller to switch between your speaker system and your 7.1 headphones. The speakers feature dynamic volume control allowing you to change each of your speaker levels individually. Easy to install and amazing sound. Only problem with the device is the sensitive mute button, although not much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: James Mackie

customer_reviews.title: IT IS GARBAGE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Within a year it will break. I have had many headsets over the years but the flimsy structure and engineering will fail. The head set will break at the top. It is not strong enough for day to day use. I have purchased TWO (2), yes two of these and they both broke the same way!!! Same place and after 1 year of ownership!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Honest-Abe

customer_reviews.title: Great for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my husband, he wont take them off lol Great for Gaming
customer_reviews.author: RW

product_meta.title: Razer Tiamat Over Ear 7.1 Surround Sound PC Gaming Headset
product_meta.description:
RAZER TIAMAT OVER EAR 7.1 SURROUND SOUND PC GAMING HEADSET - THE WORLD'S FIRST TRUE 7.1 GAMING HEADSET
Behold the Razer Tiamat 7.1, the world’s first over-ear gaming headset with 10 discrete drivers built-in to deliver the ultimate 7.1 Surround Sound experience. Dominate deathmatches when you can hear incoming enemy footsteps to prevent backstabs and pinpoint enemy locations through gunfire with absolute precision. No other surround sound headset has been engineered to produce such lifelike positional audio geared for the ultimate tactical advantage.

"The Tiamat 7.1 is more than just a surround sound theatre wrapped around your head." - IGN "This 7.1 headset from Razer is a high-end product that delivers on Razer's promises, and for the right PC gamer, it's the perfect surround-sound solution." - GameSpot MAXIMUM COMFORT, MAXIMUM DURABILITY
The Razer Tiamat 7.1's sturdy construction and padded leatherette ear cups ensure extended headset life and ultimate comfort so you can keep going during those hardcore marathon gaming sessions.

FULL AUDIO CUSTOMIZATION
Easily and accurately fine-tune the level of each audio channel, position, and bass depth to your exact enjoyment using the supplied control unit.

7.1 SURROUND SOUND WITH LIFELIKE POSITIONAL AUDIO
A world's first, the 10 individual drivers in the Razer Tiamat 7.1 provide immersive, crystal clear surround sound. The reproduced audio is so rich and lifelike that not only will you feel like you’re right there, you'll have the edge over your enemies. Let 'em try sneaking up on you now.

TOTAL AUDIO MASTERY IN YOUR HANDS
Set the volume, audio positioning, and bass depth as you want via the audio control unit. Whether it’s configured to blast a full frontal wall of sound or scaled down to simple stereo, get the right level of intensity for your gaming audio every time.

"... it was the best 7.1-channel experience we've experienced with a headset." - TechRadar 

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * True-to-life 7.1 Surround Sound from 10 discrete drivers 
 * All-in-one volume control unit for multi-channel customization and toggling between headset and speakers 
 * Comfortable, snug fit for extended play 
 * Retractable, noise-filtering unidirectional mic 
 * Interchangeable ear cup covers 
 * Replaceable soft-touch leatherette ear cushions 
 * Braided fibre cable 
 * Headphones 10 discrete neodymium drivers: 
 * Sub woofer: 
 * Drivers: 2 x 40mm Neodymium Magnets with Titanium Coated Diaphragm 
 * Frequency Response: 20Hz – 20,000 Hz 
 * Impedance: 16Ω 
 * Sensitivity @ 1kHz: 116 dB ± 3dB 
 * Front: 
 * Drivers: 2 x 30mm Neodymium Magnets 
 * Frequency Response: 20Hz - 20,000 Hz 
 * Impedance: 32 Ω 
 * Sensitivity @ 1kHz: 123dB ± 3dB 
 * Rear: 
 * Drivers: 2 x 20mm Neodymium Magnets 
 * Frequency Response: 20Hz - 20,000 Hz 
 * Impedance: 32 Ω 
 * Sensitivity @ 1kHz: 120dB ± 3dB 
 * Center: 
 * Drivers: 2 x 30mm Neodymium Magnets 
 * Frequency Response: 20Hz - 20,000 Hz 
 * Impedance: 32 Ω 
 * Sensitivity @ 1kHz: 123dB ± 3dB 
 * Side: 
 * Drivers: 2 x 20mm Neodymium Magnets 
 * Frequency Response: 20Hz - 20,000 Hz 
 * Impedance: 32 Ω 
 * Sensitivity @ 1kHz: 120dB ± 3dB 
 * Microphone:
 * Frequency Response: 50 – 16,000 Hz 
 * Sensitivity @1kHz: -36 dB ± 2dB 
 * Signal-to-Noise Ratio: 50 dB 
 * Pick-up Pattern: Unidirectional 
 * Volume Control Unit: 
 * Master Volume, front speakers, centre speakers, sub-woofer speakers, side speakers, rear speakers, microphone volume, microphone mute, audio mute, 7.1 surround sound & 2.0 stereo mode toggle and speaker/headset toggle 
 * Cable: 3 metres, braided fibre sheath 
 * Micro-USB Audio-Out 
 * Micro-USB Audio-In 
 * PC Connector: Microphone-In, 4x Audio-Out 
 * Speakers Connector: 4x Audio-Out, 1x Audio-In 
 * System Requirements 
 * PC with built-in 3.5mm audio jacks & 1 USB port 
 * 7.1 Surround Sound-enabled Sound Card (for 7.1 Mode) 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Tiamat 7.1 A world's first, the 10 individual drivers in the Razer Tiamat 7.1 provide immersive, crystal clear surround sound. The reproduced audio is so rich and lifelike that not only will you feel like you're right there, you'll have the edge over your enemies. Let 'em try sneaking up on you now.
feature_bullets: Full Audio Customization - Easily and accurately fine-tune the level of each audio channel, position, and bass depth to your exact enjoyment using the supplied control unit.

Maximum comfort, maximum durability - The Razer Tiamat 7.1's sturdy construction and padded leatherette ear cups ensure extended headset life and ultimate comfort so you can keep going during those hardcore marathon gaming sessions.
Retractable, noise-filtering unidirectional mic - Speak and be heard with complete clarity. Stores away easily and quickly when not in use.
System Requirements-PC with built-in 3.5mm audio jacks & 1 USB port and 7.1 Surround Sound-enabled Sound Card (for 7.1 Mode)
